For all measurements nuclear model calculations
were produced using models of the Hauser-
- Experimental data following application of various
corrections. Most of these correction procedures
were standard. The neutron scattering corrections
were derived by the Monte-Carlo method using the
computer code (MCNP-4C). The raw experimental data
were corrected for the following effects:
. Fluctuations in neutron flux during the
. Multiple scattering of the neutrons in samples.
-Auxiliary aluminum, iron, nickel, indium, and niobium
samples were used at various times during the
measurements, either to serve as secondary standards
for neutron fluence determination or for the purpose
of establishing corrections for low-energy neutrons
via the method of spectral indexing.
For central sample activity measurement at the
Long counter working in multichannel scaling
Total Errors for the cross sections were
deduced by combining partial errors from
various sources in quadrature. Error sources

Deuterium beam current is aprx 15 micro-A,
beam energy is from 1 to 4 MeV .
H-3(d,n)He-4. Deuterons incident on a metal
on a silver backing (0.5 mm thick). This reaction
generated primary neutrons with energies in the range
13.4 to 20.6 MeV. Energy scale uncertainty is 5 keV.

- By the authors - these cross sections were measured
using natural molybdenum samples since there were no

-These cross sections were measured using natural
molybdenum sample material. The samples were very
large, consisting of plates stacked around the target
at various angles. The chosen sample geometry was a
compromise between the need to provide large samples
owing to the very long half life of Nb-94G and the
requirement of minimizing radiation absorption in
these samples. Long irradiation times were required
in order to generate sufficient Nb-94G activity for
The irradiated molybdenum samples were cooled for a
sufficient time to allow all Nb-94M activity to decay
by isomeric transitions to the ground state of Nb-94.
Summed contributions from three distinct reactions on
natural molybdenum were measured in this experiment.
Thus, the indicated cross sections correspond to
Nb-94m+g production from neutrons on natural
